page.title: 08Village blacksmith's Wife.
page.content: She explained that the{village}of Baston has changed little over the eighteen years which she and her husband have spent here. She finds the old part of the village a pleasant and close community although the new estate has a more shifting{population. The most significant change has been the advent of the{private school,} bringing both advantages such as a constant use of the village church and disadvantages such as the increase in the villages traffic. Most village socializing is done through the church,W.I. but particularly the local pub. She is kept busy during the day with household chores and as acting secretary to her husband. She enjoys the peaceful rural life but feels it has become essential to be a car owner.She has sealed a{'time capsule'} into the wall of her house.
